titles.title: To require the Director of the Financial Crimes Enforcement Network to submit a report to Congress on the way in which data collected pursuant to title 31 is being used, and for other purposes.
Improving Strategies to Counter Weapons Proliferation Act
Improving Strategies to Counter Weapons Proliferation Act

Improving Strategies to Counter Weapons Proliferation Act
Improving Strategies to Counter Weapons Proliferation Act

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by the Yeas and Nays: 56 - 0.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Financial Services. H. Rept. 115-905.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 701.

action.text: Mr. Tipton moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 6332.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs.

committee.name: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

bill.summary:
Improving Strategies to Counter Weapons Proliferation Act
(Sec. 2) This bill requires the Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (FinCEN) to report on the usage of financial activity data collected by FinCEN related to weapons proliferation.
